required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Evaluation of Posterior Direct Restoration in Adolescents
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Evaluation of Posterior Direct Restoration in Adolescents

collaborator.agency: Coordination for the Improvement of Higher Education Personnel
Fundação de Amparo à Pesquisa do estado de Minas Gerais
Conselho Nacional de Desenvolvimento Científico e Tecnológico

brief_summary.textblock: The present study aims to evaluate the performance of direct restorations with bulk fill resins in molars with great structural loss, with endodontic treatment. The behavior of class II restorations in 68 molars endodontically treated with bulk fill resin and incremental technique will be evaluated by means of a randomized clinical trial with a two-year follow-up. This project aims to evaluate the performance of this new restorative strategy that can greatly contribute to restorations of posterior teeth.

detailed_description.textblock: Sixty-eight endodontically treated molars were restored in 54 adolescents (10-18 years old, mean= 14.0 +- 2.4). Teeth were randomly assigned to the incremental filling technique (Filtek Z230/Vitremer, 3M-ESPE, n = 31) or high viscosity bulk fill technique (Filtek Bulk Fill Posterior, 3M-ESPE, n = 37). The restorations were clinically evaluated at baseline, 12 and 24 months by two independent raters using modified United States Public Health Service criteria. Data analysis included descriptive statistics, Mann-Whitney and Friedman non-parametric tests, and Generalized Estimating Equation (GEE) analysis.

secondary_outcome.description: color alteration in the adhesive interface

arm_group.description: Glass ionomer in the pulp chamber and incremental filling technique using composite resin
Bulk fill composite resin filling all the cavity
